item.title: Lens for PC now available in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Available at a 15 percent-off launch discount price.

The PC version of horror adventure game Lens is now available via Steam, publisher Nippon Ichi Software and developer Orgesta announced. It is currently available at a 15 percent-off launch discount price of $50.99 / 6,732 yen, but will change to $59.99 / 7,920 yen after November 13. It only features Japanese language support.

Lens first launched for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch on August 28 in Japan. Read more about the game here.

item.title: Dokapon 3-2-1 Super Collection! announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Due out on January 29, 2026 in Japan.

Sting has announced Dokapon 3-2-1 Super Collection! for Switch. It will launch both physically and digitally on January 29, 2026 in Japan.

The collection includes the following three titles:

  • Dokapon 3-2-1: Arashi o Yobu Yuujou (1994, Super Famicom)
  • Kessen! Dokapon Oukoku IV: Densetsu no Yuusha Tachi (1993, Super Famicom)
  • Dokapon Gaiden: Honoo no Audition (1995, Super Famicom)

Each title will come equipped with new features like a double speed mode and an instruction manual mode. The new key visual is illustrated by Ami Shibata.

item.title: Co-op action RPG Triarchy announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
New Zealand-based studio Digital Confectioners has announced Triarchy, a cooperative action RPG for up to three players. It will launch for PC via Steam in 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Sail your ship, explore islands, fight monsters, choose your abilities, and craft legendary gear to hunt for deadly bosses. Play Triarchy your way! Activate Boss Challenge Modes or enable Assists to suit your playstyle. Open-world, cooperative, action adventure for one-to-three players.

A Cooperative Adventure Across an Open Archipelago (One-to-Three Players)

Sail, explore, and fight across a drowned world. Craft legendary gear and master your abilities to hunt for deadly bosses. Play solo or with friends as you uncover the secrets of the mysterious Triarchy.

  • Drop-In / Drop-Out – Join a friend’s world at any point in their journey.
  • No Barriers or Tethering – Freely explore the world together or separately.
  • Shared Progress – Any loot or progression made is saved to your character.
  • Enemy Scaling – Encounters scale with your crew size for a fair fight.

Deadly Bosses: Hunt, Fight, Overcome

Hunt for deadly bosses across the isles! Each boss will test you and your crew with distinct patterns, multi-phase battles, and arena hazards that reward timing, positioning, and teamwork.

  • Solo or Cooperative Play – Fights are balanced for one-to-three players.
  • Rewards – Unique upgrade materials and boss exclusive gear.
  • Challenge Modes – Allowing you and your crew to fight bosses again on harder difficulties. Overcome the challenge for greater rewards!
  • Master the Fight
    • Ability Synergy – As you level-up, use your Talent Tree to unlock and master powerful abilities. From decimating your foes to supporting your allies, talent tree abilities let you help your party and define your own unique playstyle.
    • Melee Precision – Triarchy emphasizes intentional melee combat providing endless opportunities for growth and mastery. Fights hinge on stamina, poise breaks, and carefully timed dodges. Parry windows reward precision, and over-committing will leave you exposed to counter attacks. A vast array of weapons can be discovered, each with their own unique style and feel. Further unleash your power and creativity with freeform dual-wield combos to mix blades and their unique on-hit effects.

Craft Your Hero: Your Look, Your Build, Your Legend

Triarchy offers diverse customization options:

  • Choose your look in the Character Creator
  • Craft new armor, weapons, and more to define your build
  • Level-up and choose new abilities that best fit your playstyle

Upgrade Your Ship: Your Mobile Base

Your ship is more than transport, it’s a fully customizable and upgradeable floating base. Outfit your ship with specialized upgrade paths that dramatically change how you explore and play:

  • Hulls, Sails, and More! – Upgrade for more speed, durability, and utility.
  • Navigation Tools – Create the Map Table to help chart farther horizons and discover new challenges!
  • Base To-Go – With your workbench and stashes traveling with you, there’s always a safe point to group up and craft.

Play Your Way: Assists and Boss Challenge Modes

Triarchy is designed for everyone to enjoy, from hardcore to casual players:

  • Boss Challenges – Rematch bosses and find secret triggers to fight them on harder difficulties! Challenge Mode bosses feature new abilities, attack patterns, and balance tuning. Slaying these bosses offer better rewards for the most daring adventurers.
  • Assists – Assists are enabled per-player, allowing you to explore Triarchy at your own pace and play your way.
    • Adjust Game Difficulty Like – Damage taken, damage dealt, parry window, stamina drain, and more. Your settings don’t affect others, and can be changed at anytime.

Tech and Accessibility

  • Remappable Inputs: Gamepad (Xbox, PlayStation), keyboard and mouse.
  • Ultrawide monitor support.
  • Colorblind presets.

Watch the announcement trailer below. Visit the official website here.

item.title: QUByte Emulation Engine adds PS1 support; three titles announced for modern platforms
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Invasion from Beyond, Motor Mash, and One.

QUByte Interactive‘s in-house QUbyte Emulation Engine has expanded to officially support the original PlayStation, and the company plans to release ‘many cult favorites’ from the platform across modern platforms, it announced.

As part of the announcement, QUByte Interactive revealed the following three titles are coming to modern platforms:

  • Invasion from Beyond (known as B-Movie in Europe) (1998)
  • Motor Mash (1997)
  • One (1997)

Release dates were not announced.

item.title: Top Racer Collection DLC ‘Top Racer Customs’ announced
item.content:encoded:
QUByte Interactive has announced Top Racer Collection downloadable content “Top Racer Customs.” It will launch on November 6.

Here is an overview of the content, via QUByte Interactive:

The nostalgia of the tracks is back with even more excitement!

The classic Top Racer Collection, which brings together four legendary racing games from the 90s, now receives brand-new content: the “Top Racer Customs” downloadable content.

  • For the first time in the history of the franchise, players can customize their cars in Top Racer 1—not only visually, creating a unique style for each machine, but also in performance, adjusting speed, acceleration, nitro power, and fuel capacity.
  • And it doesn’t stop there: customized cars can be shared with other players. Who will be able to create the ultimate machine? This is your chance to build the perfect car for every track and challenge friends and rivals in adrenaline-fueled races
  • On top of that, four brand-new cars are making their debut exclusively in Top Racer 1—all inspired by iconic models from the 80s and 90s that left their mark on the roads of that era. A heartfelt tribute to retro car culture and to the passionate fans who made Top Racer a timeless success.

Top Racer Collection is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Street Racer Collection launches November 27 for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Includes the SNES, Mega Drive, and MS-DOS versions of the game.

QUByte Interactive will release Street Racer Collection for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on November 27, the developer announced. It includes the Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Mega Drive, and MS-DOS versions of the 1994-released Street Racer.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Combining the speed of an arcade racer with the brawling of a fighting game, this cult classic made its mark with its originality and its own dose of chaos and personality.

Race on tracks filled with obstacles and crazy settings (from Mount Rushmore to Transylvania), use special moves to knock out your rivals, and explore modes that go far beyond traditional racing.

Get ready to laugh, crash, accelerate, and fight for every corner.

Street Racer Collection is pure arcade fun, straight from the past to your screen.

Four Game Modes

  • Practice –  Train before competing for real.
  • Head-to-Head – Race against a single opponent on a track of your choice.
  • Championship – Create your own competitions by combining tracks and difficulty levels.
  • Rumble Mode – Knock your opponents out of the arena!
  • Soccer Mode – Play soccer… with race cars! (not available in the MS-DOS version)

What You’ll Find

  • Four games in one! The collection includes the Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Mega Drive, MS-DOS, and Game Boy versions of the game.
  • Up to 27 unique tracks full of shortcuts, traps, and challenges.
  • Eight cartoon characters with crazy vehicles and special attacks.
  • Varied racing options: from a quick lap to 80-lap marathons!
  • Local multiplayer for up to four players (on Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Mega Drive, and MS-DOS versions)

Why Play Street Racer Collection?

  • A true cult classic, remembered to this day for its creativity and boldness.
  • Unique and pioneering mix of kart racing and combat.
  • Guaranteed fun in both solo and local multiplayer modes.
  • A piece of video game history, preserved in its original form and experience.
  • Get ready to laugh, crash, accelerate, and fight for every corner.
  • Street Racer Collection is pure arcade fun, straight from the past to your screen.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer
